intro: Micromeria × tapeinantha, commonly known as the hybrid desert sage, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Micromeria × tapeinantha is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
